The kids going to school are in real danger.

Along Essex St. between Washington and Surface Road: since the two restaurants in this area have closed, these few blocks have been neglected.  They have turned into an area of blight in close proximity to Downtown Crossing and South Station.  Walking in the area in the dark has become hazardous.  In the past month during hours of darkness my elderly father was chased as he returned to my home at 7:30pm, my mother and husband were forced off the sidewalk by two intoxicated men around 9:00 pm, and I was assaulted at 6:15 am on my way to work (reported to MBTA police).  I need to walk in this area in a daily basis with my young son in order to go in and out of my home and it has become scary.  It seems other areas in the neighborhood have solved this by adding some extra street lights, cleaning up some mess (blankets, bottles, needles) from the sidewalk in order to show that people are paying attention to goings on.  Please help the residents, commuters and visitors to this neighborhood.

status_notes: Case Resolved. Dear Constituent. . Eversource Electric after repairing an emergency recently realized that the entire conduit on Bowen St needed to be replaced. That is why they are out there now.  The City highly encourages this type of work. It will eliminate possible future emergency leak repairs. . The city acknowledges that the construction will cause an inconvenience to the residents. . However in the long run the construction is well worth it. . Even though the contractor will be installing a new main usually for hundreds of feet and in some cases the entire street, we have told the contractor to only post where he will be for the next few days. This will allow more parking on the street. That is why you sometimes see the date changes on the signs. We have told the contractor to make sure that the signs are accurate. Please don't hesitate to use the police officer on detail or the contractor to make sure that you have access in and out. We believe the work will be done either this week or next. You can email the Eversource supervisor at carol.boyan@eversource.com. Even though this is a definite improvement for the residents of Bowen St the City and Eversource will try to minimize the inconvenience the best we can. For any questions or concerns, please contact the number listed below. Sincerely,. Mark Cardarelli. Supervisor of Utility Coordination and Compliance. Boston Public Works Department. 617-635-4951 Office.

status_notes: Case Noted. The watering bags were properly installed by the planting contractor to the specifications set forth by the City Arborist. The watering bags should be installed around the tree stake itself and not the trunk of the tree. This is done to prevent the trunk of the tree from being damaged by the wet conditions that the watering bag creates around the trunk as well as to encourage new root growth outside of the root ball. Since the watering bag sits on top of the root ball it still waters the tree when it is filled.

status_notes: Case Resolved. Dear Constituent,. The Boston Public Works Construction Inspection Unit (CIU) has identified the gas trench needing attention as being the responsibility of Feeney Brothers. Note: The National Grid lock out has resulted in all contract work for main installation to be suspended . We have requested the trench be repaired as soon ass possible. Because it is winter asphalt plants are not open all the time and the weather is not conducive to a good repair ... we will request low spots be topped now and a permanent repair done in the spring. The location has been entered into the CIU data base that tracks repairs to be made by utility companies or private contractors. . We apologize for the inconvenience. . Sincerely,. . Mark Cardarelli. Supervisor of Utility Coordination and Compliance. Boston Public Works Department. 617-635-4951 Office.
